column4: ertUSUL: I only have one processor but it's dual core. Should I see one process or two?
where do I get the SMP kernel
from synaptic is the  linux-686-smp package
afaics top does not show the number of cpus
It does. I manage another server that has two cpus and I can hit 1 and see both of them.
It does. What am I looking for?
how many processosrs your kernel thnks you have... in dapper there was still an special *-smp kernel iirc
so you may need to install it
but as i said in dapper you need the smp kernel
did you installed and booted the smp kernel?
it is maybe to knew for the dapper kernel 2.6.15 is an old release
try with the kernel from edgy... dl the deb from packages.ubuntu.com it might work
althought if i were you i would install a newer version of ubuntu server
